meanings.definition: A dead body, especially one intended for dissection.
meanings.sent1: The medical students studied the cadaver in anatomy class.
meanings.sent2: The police found a cadaver in the abandoned building.
meanings.sent3: The cadaver seemed to be playing a game of hide and seek in the morgue.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with the cadavers of fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cadaver on the table haunted her dreams.

meanings.sent1: The detectives examined the cadaver for clues to solve the crime.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tomb was filled with cadavers of long-gone warriors.
meanings.sent3: The cadaver at the Halloween party was surprisingly good at dancing.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned factory was a cadaver of the once-thriving industry.
meanings.sent5: The smell of decay surrounded the cadaver in the old cemetery.
